questions.question: Which one of these events took place in 1787?
Which one of these was the effect of Shay's Rebellion?
What was the name of the 85 essays written in support of the Constitution?
Which group feared giving too much power to the President would lead to a monarchy?
Which one of these men helped to write the Federalist Papers?
The Articles of Confederation, the Bill of Rights and the Federalist Papers were all written in what era?
Why were southern delegates to the Constitutional Convention willing to accept the Three-Fifths Compromise?

choices.answer: It increased the political power of the south.
It allowed indentured servants in the South to become citizens.
It decreased the federal tax on property in the South.
It allowed the South to expand its industrial output.

questions.question: The New Jersey Plan and the Virginia Plan combined to make what?
How did the provisions of the Northwest Ordinance affect U.S. expansion?

choices.answer: By funding a transportation network in uninhabited regions
By establishing a process for territories to govern themselves
By promoting a growth of southern plantation economies
By creating a national bank to loan money to land investors

questions.question: The ability to declare war, make treaties and operate post offices were strengths of which document?
The Northwest Ordinance is considered a historical milestone because it...

choices.answer: more than doubled the size of the U.S.
establisehd a method for admitting new states to the Union
encouraged state legislatures to ratify the Constitution
proposed treaties with American Indians to allow peaceful settlement

questions.question: Which of these statements most likely came from a Federalist?

choices.answer: A bill of rights should be included in the Constitution
Having a stronger central government will make the country stable
The Three-Fifths Compromise will result in fair and equal representation
Universal suffrage should be guaranteed in the Constitution

questions.question: Why was it difficult for Congress to do anything under the A.O.C?

choices.answer: Any congressional action required executive approval
Congress lacked the power to declare war
Most congressional decisions required the approval of 9 out of 13 states
Congress lacked power to regulate trade

questions.question: Which one of these does not match with weaknesses of the A.O.C?

choices.answer: No power to tax or regulate trade
Designed to be stronger than the states

questions.question: Which pair of men opposed the Constitution because they believed it made the government too powerful?
Which question reflects a major concern states had about only having one vote in Congress under the A.O.C?

choices.answer: Should states attempt to resolve conflicting claims to territory?
Should states change their procedure for selecting representatives?
Should unanimous state approval for national laws be required?
Should more populous states receive greater representation?
